      • getState

        public String getState(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                       GuiPoint cursor)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Gets the current state of the component for the given parameters. This methods main purpose is to allow caching and reduce the need to render and send data. This method can be executed very frequently (by default every 50ms for every interacting player) so don't do any heavy calculations here.
        If Component.apply(Graphics, Player, GuiPoint) renders different content, then the this method should return different strings. If it renders the same the return value should be the same.
        A good way to achieve this is to just 'describe' what you would render. (e.g. the RectComponent returns x+"*"+y+"*"+width+"*"+height+"*"+color.getRGB())
        Specified by:
        getState in class Component
        Parameters:
        player - the player
        cursor - the cursor
        Returns:
        the state

        public TextComponent clone(Interaction interaction)

      • locateOn

        public TextComponent locateOn(Interaction interaction)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Locate the same component on a different interaction.
        In most cases return value can safely be casted to concrete component class.
        Alias for:
        interaction.getComponentTree().locate(component.getId())
        Overrides:
        locateOn in class Component
        Parameters:
        interaction - the interaction
        Returns:
        the component
